bug.short_desc: wine package(s) missing 32-bit cups lib dependency
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: wine apps won't print if the 32-bit cups lib has not been installed. Was not obvious that the reason wine apps could not see the available printers was the lack of the 32-bit cups lib. This dependency is included in the winehq fedora package.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): cups 2.1.4 wine 1.9.16 fedora 24
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2. 3.
Actual results: message displayed after clicking on File/Print... in Notepad Before you can perform printer-related tasks such as page setup or printing a document, you need to install a printer. Please install one and retry.
Expected results: List of printers when printing from gedit Print to File HP_LaserJet_Professional_M1212nf_MFP HP_LaserJet_Professional_M1212nf_MFP_fax
Additional info:

Wine has a fallback that allows printing to work without cups-libs.i686 installed. I've tested it and it works without the lib. However, it has reduced functionality (full printer name not shown) with the lib missing. I'll add a hard dependency in the next update.
